titleproper.value: Guide to the Virginia Nelson Speiden Carper Collection on New York University Summer School <num>MC.264</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-03-22T18:01:56</date>

unittitle.value: Virginia Nelson Speiden Carper Collection on New York University Summer School

abstract.value: Virginia Nelson Speiden Carper (1908-2005) was from Manassas, Virginia and the daughter of architect Albert Speiden. In 1931 she attended New York University Summer School to study music education. This collection consists of materials collected by Virginia Nelson Speiden Carper documenting her attendance at NYU in the summer of 1931. Materials in this collection include correspondence regarding classes and accommodations, a lecture outline for a class on music education, a map of New York City, a copy of <emph render="italic">The Summer School News</emph>, a program for "Philadelphia in Music: Past and Present," Pullman Company passenger car fare checks, receipts, and newspaper clippings. The collection also includes documents from Hotel Judson, which hosted summer school students.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Virginia Nelson Speiden Carter Collection of Materials on New York University Summer School; MC 264; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.
Donated by Mary Helen Dellinger in May, 2016; the accession associated with this gift is 2019.032.
Virginia Nelson Speiden Carper (1908-2005) was from Manassas, Virginia and the daughter of architect Albert Speiden. In 1931 she attended NYU Summer School to study music education.

This collection consists of materials collected by Virginia Nelson Speiden Carper documenting her attendance at New York University's Summer School in 1931. Materials in this collection include correspondence regarding classes and accommodations, a lecture outline for a class on music education, a map of New York City, a copy of <emph render="italic">The Summer School News</emph>, a program for "Philadelphia in Music: Past and Present," Pullman Company passenger car fare checks, receipts, and newspaper clippings. The collection also includes documents from Hotel Judson, which hosted summer school students.
